    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init(javax.servlet.ServletContext application,
        org.apache.commons.configuration.PropertiesConfiguration torqueConfig)
        Parameters:
        application -
        torqueConfig - This will instantiate and configure a Quartz scheduler. Database related configuration items are taken from the Torque configuration such as not to duplicate JDBC URLs, database type, user, and password entries. Some properties can be configured in file /WEB-INF/Quartz.properties, for example configuration parameters for clustering.

      • startScheduler

        public static void startScheduler()
        Routine to start the Quartz scheduler. This reads the configuration file /WEB-INF/quartz-jobs.xml and configures all jobs and triggers with the appropriate job classes. Hence, all configuration is done via this xml file, there is no coding necessary to add any additional jobs, triggers and listeners.

      • clearScheduler

        public static void clearScheduler()
        Clears all triggers of this scheduler.

      • clearJobs

        public static void clearJobs()
        Clears all triggers of this scheduler.

      • stopScheduler

        public static void stopScheduler()
        Stops the scheduler. It will wait until all jobs have been completed.

      • getDBJobCronExpression

        public static java.lang.String getDBJobCronExpression()
        Get the current cron expression for the database backup job.
        Returns:
        a String with the cron expression

      • setDBJobCronExpression

        public static boolean setDBJobCronExpression(java.lang.String cronExpression)
        Replaces for the database trigger the cron expression with a new one.
        Parameters:
        cronExpression -
        Returns:
        true if successful
